$$

So the support of cdf of V with its support is:

$$
F_{V}(v) = 
\left\{

# Problem 2

![](images/4691706478253_.pic.jpg)

**(a) Answer:**

Since $\lambda$ is positive, $f(x) = \frac{1}{2} \lambda e^{-\lambda |x|}$ is positive for all x.

$\int_{-\infty}^{\infty}f(t)=\int_{0}^{\infty}\frac{1}{2}\lambda e^{-\lambda t}+\int_{-\infty}^{0}\frac{1}{2}\lambda e^{\lambda t}=-\frac{1}{2} e^{-\lambda t}\Big|_0^\infty + \frac{1}{2} e^{\lambda t}\Big|_{-\infty}^{0}=\frac{1}{2}+\frac{1}{2}=1$

Both properties of pdf have satisfied. We can conclude that $f(x)$ is a pdf.

**(b) Answer:**

$P(X<t)=F_{X}(t)$

$$
F_{X}(t) = 
\left\{
    \begin{array}{ll}
        \int_{-\infty}^{t} \frac{1}{2} \lambda e^{\lambda x} dx & \text{if } t < 0 \\
        \int_{-\infty}^{0} \frac{1}{2} \lambda e^{\lambda x} dx+\int_{0}^{t} \frac{1}{2} \lambda e^{-\lambda x} dx & \text{if } t \geq 0
    \end{array}
\right.
$$

$$
F_{X}(t) = 
\left\{
    \begin{array}{ll}
        \frac{1}{2}e^{\lambda t} & \text{if } t < 0 \\
        \frac{1}{2}-\frac{1}{2} e^{-\lambda t}+\frac{1}{2} =1-\frac{1}{2} e^{-\lambda t}& \text{if } t \geq 0 
    \end{array}
\right.
$$

**(c) Answer:**

By break out the absolute value of X, we have range of X: $X>t$ or $X<-t$

$$
F_{X}(t) = 
\left\{
    \begin{array}{ll}
        \int_{t}^{-t} \frac{1}{2} \lambda e^{\lambda x} dx & \text{if } t < 0 \\
        \int_{-\infty}^{0} \frac{1}{2} \lambda e^{\lambda x} dx+\int_{0}^{t} \frac{1}{2} \lambda e^{-\lambda x} dx & \text{if } t \geq 0
    \end{array}
\right.
$$

# Problem 4

![](images/4711706478272_.pic.jpg)

**Answer:**

Since X is uniform distribution, the pdf of X is:

$$
f_{X}(x) = 
\left\{
    \begin{array}{ll}
        0 & \text{if } x < -1 \\
        \frac{1}{2} & \text{if } -1\leq x \leq 1 \\ 
        0 & \text{if } x > 1 
    \end{array}
\right.
$$
Then, the cdf of X is:

$$
F_{X}(x) = 
\left\{
    \begin{array}{ll}
        0 & \text{if } x < -1 \\
        \frac{1}{2}x & \text{if } -1\leq x \leq 1 \\ 
        1 & \text{if } x > 1 
    \end{array}
\right.
$$

# Problem 6

![](images/4731706478289_.pic.jpg)

**Answer:**

Based on the assumption, we have

$$
F_X(x)=P(X<x) = 
\left\{
    \begin{array}{ll}
        0 & \text{if } x \leq 0 \\
        \frac{\pi x^2}{\pi}=x^2 & \text{if } 0<x<1 \\
        1& \text{if } x \geq 1 
    \end{array}
\right.
$$ Then, the pdf of X is:

$$
f(x) = 
\left\{
    \begin{array}{ll}
        2x & \text{if } 0<x<1 \\
        0& \text{else }  
    \end{array}
\right.
$$

Since $Y=X^3$, the cdf of Y is:

$$
F_Y(y)=P(Y<y) = 
\left\{
    \begin{array}{ll}
        0 & \text{if } y \leq 0 \\
        y^{\frac{1}{3}} & \text{if } 0<y<1 \\
        1& \text{if } y \geq 1 
    \end{array}
\right.
$$

Then, the pdf of Y is:

$$
f(y) = 
\left\{
    \begin{array}{ll}
        \frac{1}{3}y^{-2/3} & \text{if } 0<y<1 \\
        0& \text{else }  
    \end{array}
\right.
$$
